TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void WebPartConnectionsEventHandler(object sender, WebPartConnectionsEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed WebPartConnectionsEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub WebPartConnectionsEventHandler(sender As Object, e As WebPartConnectionsEventArgs)
public delegate void WebPartConnectionsEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, WebPartConnectionsEventArgs ^ e);
type WebPartConnectionsEventHandler = delegate of obj * WebPartConnectionsEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the and events of the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionsEventHandler> class defines a handler delegate for two events that occur on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control: the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsConnected> event and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsDisconnected> event. The method that handles the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsConnected> event is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.OnWebPartsConnected%2A> method. The method that handles the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsDisconnected> event is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.OnWebPartsDisconnected%2A> method. In both cases, the event data are contained in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionsEventArgs> object.
